attributes.action: Re-consider the proposed ban on nitrous oxide in clubs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The proposed ban on selling laughing gas (nitrous) in clubs and pubs is a violation of our human rights to have a good time, what right does this government have to ban a harmless chemical (when used safely, such as the method used in clubs) while alcohol and tobacco are still legalised?

Come on people, fight for your right to have a good time safely.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Re-consider the proposed ban on nitrous oxide in clubs."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12402.asp

Prime Minister's Office
